content: The federal government has a strong interest in regulating hazardous chemicals security to prevent terrorist attacks since September 11, 2001. Congress focuses on the security of hazardous chemicals in transportation and storage facilities to reduce the risk of exploitation by terrorists. In response to the security concerns post-9/11, Congress is reviewing federal policies on hazardous chemical transportation by rail, truck, and marine vessels. Legislation such as H.R. 2651 and S. 1052 aim to increase penalties for criminal activities around ports and enhance general port security. Congress is expected to seek a broader understanding of hazardous chemical marine shipments and their security measures.
